Biotech is not just the future, it‚Äôs India‚Äôs present revolution.

With 11,000+ startups driving the change, the sector is making waves globally.

Minister of State for Science and Technology, credits this phenomenal growth to strong policy backing, institutional support, and a vibrant innovation ecosystem. With initiatives like Vigyan Dhara, BioE3, and BIRAC's funding support of up to ‚Çπ50 L, the momentum is only building up.

From biodegradable packaging to eco-friendly personal care and green jobs, India is harnessing bioproducts not just for the lab‚Äîbut for livelihoods.
The vision?
A $300 Bn bioeconomy by 2030, and India leading the global charge.

Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal

#StartupIndia #DPIIT #Biotech #Innovation #StartupNews

To accelerate student-driven deep-tech ventures, DPIIT has signed an MoU with CoCreate Ventures. The partnership aims to convert India‚Äôs campuses into national innovation hubs, offering support through hackathons, industry tie-ups, and startup challenges.

With a record of over 75 innovation projects and 50 patents, CoCreate is well-equipped to mentor and invest in university founders.

DPIIT's Joint Secretary, Shri Sanjiv confirmed this collaboration as key to aligning youth innovation with national priorities like Digital India and Atmanirbhar Bharat.

This MoU marks a new chapter in India's startup journey, empowering student ideas to scale globally.

Read more: https://bit.ly/3GAi5De

üéâ Big congratulations to Dozee, one of IKP-supported startups, on receiving the CE mark for its AI-powered Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) system! 

This regulatory milestone opens the door to 30+ countries across the European Economic Area, taking Dozee‚Äôs Made-in-India innovation to global healthcare markets. With a contactless sensor and AI-powered early warning system, Dozee tracks vitals like heart rate, oxygen saturation, and temperature‚Äîempowering proactive, data-driven care.

From securing US FDA 510(k) clearance to impacting 300+ hospitals across India, the US, Middle East, and Africa, Dozee exemplifies how Indian deeptech can drive world-class, scalable healthcare solutions.

Here's to more innovations from India transforming care‚Äîone vital sign at a time.

#Dozee #MedTech #HealthTech #RemotePatientMonitoring #CECertified #AIDrivenCare #IndianInnovation #GlobalHealthTech #DeepTech #Startups

Jaypee Institute Of Information Technology (JIIT), Noida, recently hosted a Faculty Development Program (FDP), where Dr. Bindu Nishal was invited as a distinguished speaker to deliver the inaugural address on "One Health: Innovative Solutions for Health, Productivity, and Conservation Challenges."

In her talk, "Introduction to the One Health Approach and the Role of Innovations to Solve Global One Health Challenges," Dr. Nishal emphasised the critical role of innovation in addressing interconnected global issues across human, animal, and environmental health.

She shared insights from IKP's International One Health Incubator, which currently supports four pioneering One Health start-ups. Among them is Capsber Agriscience, a start-up developing biological solutions that originated from a Master's research project‚Äîan inspiring example of how academic ideas can lead to real-world impact.

Dr. Nishal encouraged students and researchers to adopt a One Health lens‚Äîrecognising that solving today‚Äôs most urgent challenges requires integrated thinking across human, animal, and environmental health.

IKP remains committed to supporting students, scientists, and innovators who are building solutions for a healthier, more sustainable world.

#OneHealth #OneHealthApproach #InnovationForHealth #GlobalHealth #HealthInnovation #SustainableSolutions #CrossDisciplinary¬†

Dr Jitendra Kumar, Managing Director Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) shared his views on National and Global perspectives on the significance of Deep tech ecosystems and expectations from NCR-Biotech Science Cluster at the #Synchn2025 event organized by Translational Health Science and Technology Institute (THSTI) Faridabad.
He appreciated the efforts of #Industry and #academia in strong R&D engagements with respect to translational research and emerging technologies.
He highlighted the need for clusters such as NCR Biotech Cluster in institutions across the country. He stressed upon encouraging and handholding Spin outs from academia which can be taken up as examples by faculty entrepreneurs and researchers to excel.¬†
He highlighted the role of BIRAC in strengthening the Biotech ecosystem in the country. Through different funding schemes and mentorship BIRAC has nurtured startups in the domain of Biotech, MedTech, Health tech and Biopharma in developing India specific solutions and important component of Atmanirbhar Bharat. 


Department of Biotechnology
Translational Health Science and Technology Institute (THSTI)
Ganesan Karthikeyan



#Deeptech #ViksitBharat2047 #AtmanirbharBharat #Biotech #MedTech, #Healthtech #Biopharma #Ecosystems

Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) is proud to announce the successful inauguration of MJ Biopharm‚Äôs Fill-Finish Facility, supported under the National Biopharma Mission (#NBM)‚Äîa transformative step in India‚Äôs journey toward end-to-end biomanufacturing excellence.
This facility was inaugurated by Chief Guest Dr. Rajesh Gokhale Secretary DBT, DG BRIC, and Chairman BIRAC. Guest of Honour Dr. Sharmila Bapat Director, NCCS Pune also graced the occasion.
Dr. Rajesh Gokhale congratulated the team on successful establishment of the state-of-the-art ecosystem with the funding support and mentorship of National Biopharma Mission, BIRAC. The facility aligns well with the principles of BioE3 policy promoting biomanufacturing and Atmanirbhar Bharat goal.
Dr Jitendra Kumar MD BIRAC, has extended his warmest congratulations to the MJ Biopharma team and reiterates BIRAC‚Äôs firm commitment as a key enabler in the biotech and biopharma sector. He also congratulated the NBM BIRAC team for the impact it has created in the Biopharma domain. Dr. Raj K Shirumalla  Mission Director, NBM, has expressed delight at the success of yet another of the facility supported by NBM.  He emphasised that this infrastructure is expected to accelerate time-to-market for novel biologics by empowering SMEs and startups to scale efficiently and lowers barriers to entry thereby promote innovation-led growth.
NBM has also supported 100L Process Development Lab at MJ Biopharm. Levim Lifetech has also partnered with MJ Biopharma for India‚Äôs first biosimilar Liraglutide‚Äîanother NBM-supported success.
#BIRAC #NBM #BioE3 #DBT #MJBiopharm #BiopharmaInnovation #FillFinish #StartupIndia #MakeInIndia #AtmanirbharBharat #AyushmanBharat #Liraglutide #InsulinInnovation #SkillIndia

We have obtained a patent for a new technology- ‚ÄòOptiDrop‚Äô Microfluidic Droplet Flow Cytometer, developed by us in collaboration with Indian Institute of Technology, Madras!

OptiDrop is a benchtop flow-cytometry platform that provides multi-parametric optical analysis at a single cell resolution level ‚Äî
This involves the world's first non-imaging based, multiplexed, optical analysis for droplet microfluidics applications

This new tech- is affordable and much compact than traditional flow cytometers, and has game-changing downstream applications in #diagnostics, #therapeutics, #agriculture and #animalhealth such as dairy farming.¬† 

Where can OptiDrop be used:¬†
üß™Detection of fluorescently labelled or non-labelled cells¬†
üß™Study the downstream impact on individual cells during a drug screen¬†
üß™Environmental sample analyses (water contamination counter)¬†
üß™Functional characterization of CAR-T cells in immuno-oncotherapeutics¬†
üß™ Identification of CRISPR-modified single cells¬†
üß™ high-efficiency sample prep in single cell genomics

To learn more about this #technology, please reach out to the CCAMP Office of Technology Transfer (#OTT): üìß ott@ccamp.res.in ‚òéÔ∏è 080 6718 5322

This work is supported by DBT BIRAC Department Of Biotechnology, Government

IIT Mandi Catalyst, in association with SIDBI, recently conducted a curated session on ‚ÄúPost-Program Support: Providing Resources, Access to Funding, and Ongoing Mentorship‚Äù on 8th July 2025 under the Rural Entrepreneurship Development Program (REDP) supported by SIDBI.

Held at the IIT Mandi campus (H.P.), the session aimed to equip participants with the knowledge and tools needed to access resources and navigate the funding landscape after completing the program.

The session opened with a warm welcome from Dr. Dipankar Deb, Director of Incubation, who welcomed the eminent guests along with the amazing participants for the session, setting an inspiring tone for the event.

Mr. T.H.R. Samad, DGM at SIDBI, joined the session virtually and delivered a compelling keynote address. He outlined the vision and objectives of the REDP and assured continued support to the entrepreneurs, emphasizing that joining the SIDBI ecosystem means receiving lifelong guidance‚Äînot just limited to the program's duration.

The workshop also featured key insights from financial experts:
‚úÖSh. Chander Parkash (LDM, Mandi) stressed the importance of CIBIL scores and cautioned participants about hidden banking charges and the serious consequences of delayed repayments.
‚úÖMr. Vikram (PNB, Kamand Branch) provided valuable perspectives on accessing funding and relevant resources.
‚úÖ Mr. Nishant (SBI, Salgi Branch) shared an overview of financial schemes available for micro-enterprises.

üôè We extend a special thanks to all the speakers and participants for their active involvement and a shared commitment to fostering growth in our rural entrepreneurial community.

SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India)
Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Rewati Lal | Lipsa Rani Panda

#IITMandi #IITMandiCatalyst #RuralEntrepreneurship #REDP #SIDBI #StartupHimachal #EmpoweringCommunities #EntrepreneurshipDevelopment #MandiHimachal #StartupInHills

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized an engaging workshop on ‚ÄòBranding and Promotion‚Äô for its incubated startups, led by Mr. Russell Longjam (Marketing & Growth Leader, GLOBIZS).

Mr. Russell delivered a powerful session on brand building, promotion, and content marketing, focusing on how early-stage startups can develop their brand, increase visibility, and build trust‚Äîeven with limited resources.

The session covered key branding strategies, including:
üîπ Consistency in Branding
üîπ Brand Journey Framework
üîπ Core Brand Pillars & Effectiveness Measurement
üîπ Content Creation Strategies for Startups
üîπ Influencer & Community Collaboration
üîπ Storytelling Framework
üîπ Marketing Strategies for VR SaaS, Agro Analytics & Real Estate Tech

üìå Founders walked away with actionable insights to position their ventures more powerfully in today‚Äôs competitive landscape.

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) | 

#BusinessModelCanvas #StartupAcceleration #DERBIFoundation #MentorshipMatters #EarlyStageStartups #BuildMeasureLearn #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #StartupSupport #StrategyExecution #ThankYou

As a startup supported by DERBI Foundation, it's inspiring to witness global initiatives like this that are investing in purpose-driven ventures with transformative potential. 

At DERBI Foundation, we‚Äôve experienced firsthand how the right ecosystem support‚Äîaccess to prototyping, mentorship, and patient capital‚Äîcan shape the journey of early-stage innovators.

Opportunities like these validate the importance of cross-border collaboration in building technologies that don't just push the envelope but also address real-world challenges in health, sustainability, and quality of life.

Kudos to Sound Hub Denmark for amplifying the sound of the future‚Äîquite literally! üîä

https://www.linkedin.com/company/fittiit.text:
On 11th July, FITT IIT Delhi had the honour of hosting Major General C. S. Mann at our Research & Innovation Park for ‚ÄúDefenceTech & Beyond,‚Äù a dynamic panel discussion featuring:

- Major General C. S. Mann, VSM, Additional Director, Army Design Bureau
- Mr Nalin Kohli, Governing Council Member, FITT
- Dr Nikhil Agarwal, Managing Director, FITT

Major General Mann shared invaluable perspectives on the Indian Armed Forces‚Äô evolving requirements and focused on the immense potential for co-development partnerships. Our audience of defence & deep-tech startups engaged in a thought-provoking discussion on collaboration pathways, exploring how their deep-tech solutions can be tailored to real-world defence needs.

After the formal session, entrepreneurs had the opportunity to network informally with Major General Mann, deepening their understanding of how to align their technologies with the strategic priorities of our armed forces.

We‚Äôre excited to see these conversations translate into meaningful collaborations that will drive India‚Äôs defence innovation forward!

At Social Alpha, we work with bold innovators solving tough challenges‚Äîfrom sustainable farming to equitable healthcare. As part of our Communications team, you‚Äôll get to turn their work into stories that matter.¬†
Know someone who‚Äôd be a good fit? Or see yourself here?¬†

#NoHashtags #JustImpact

As India‚Äôs agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.¬† 

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India‚Äôs agricultural resilience.¬† 

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.¬† 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Wrapping Up: KVK Baramati's Agri-Innovation Insights!

Our Day 3 in Pune concluded on a high note with a visit to KVK Baramati! We were impressed by the new farming techniques brought in collaboration with international partners and how startups leverage KVK's farmer network for idea validation and reach.

Special thanks to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager, for the excellent guided tour.

This inspiring visit officially concludes our memorable Pune adventure, enriching our understanding of the region's vibrant startup landscape.

Rajendra Pawar| Agricultural Development Trust Baramati | Manish Jaiswal | Jaya Tiwari | Amit Singal | Krushik App, KVK, Baramati | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar 

#PuneEcosystem #KVKBaramati #AgriInnovation #StartupSupport #RuralTech #DeshpandeStartups

Day 3: Exploring Innovation in Baramati at AIC - ADT Baramati Foundation!

Our deep dive into the Pune startup ecosystem continued on Day 3, taking us to Baramati for an insightful visit to the AIC-ADT Baramati Foundation! It was truly inspiring to understand the dynamic ecosystem thriving in a Tier 3 city.

A heartfelt thank you to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager; Sonali Saste, Incubation Manager; and Avinash Pudale, Technology Manager, for their valuable time and for sharing their work.

We gained key insights into their success, including:
‚Ä¢ A strong on-ground network with KVK Baramati, local industry partners like Baramati Agro Ltd, and their educational institutes.
‚Ä¢ A clear sector focus on agri and allied sectors, fostering organic collaborations and expertise.
‚Ä¢ International collaborations bringing global resources to the grassroots level.
‚Ä¢ A model of smaller cohort sizes for deeper connections and greater impact on startups.

This visit was a powerful testament to the distributed nature of innovation. Our exploration continues!

Rajendra Pawar| Agricultural Development Trust Baramati | Manish Jaiswal | Jaya Tiwari | Amit Singal | Krushik App, KVK, Baramati | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar 

#PuneStartups #Baramati #AgriTech #RuralInnovation #StartupEcosystem #AICADTBaramati #DeshpandeStartups

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our ùó•ùó≤ùòÄùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóúùóªùó∞ùòÇùóØùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóøùóºùó¥ùóøùóÆùó∫ for startups offers a range of benefits‚Äîwithout taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey.

July & August at VentureStudio: five chances to up-skill, connect, and create. Whether you‚Äôre validating a med-tech device, building an AI product, sharpening your financial model, or simply curious about flavour science, the next six weeks are packed with hands-on learning and networking at Ahmedabad University.

Speaker: Namita Malhotra, Founder - Radiyes Consultants

Made in Ahmedabad, for India üáÆüá≥! Two local startups empowered at VentureStudio, Ahmedabad University, are redefining India‚Äôs drone capabilities ‚Äî right from the heart of our DST Prayas Shala fabrication lab.

üîß Alphoenix Design Pvt.Ltd.  is developing indigenous BLDC motors for drones, pushing the boundaries of hardware innovation.

ü§ù Vayunotics is collaborating with Alphoenix to integrate these motors into a cutting-edge, indigenous, autonomous system and deploying it on autopilot.

Together, they‚Äôre building India‚Äôs next-gen drone ecosystem, entirely designed, developed, and tested in Ahmedabad.

This is the power of collaborative innovation in action, and just one of many success stories powered by our robust prototyping infrastructure and startup-centric ecosystem at VentureStudio.

Learn more about Alphoenix alphoenixdesign.com

Learn more about Vayunotics vayunotics.com

Accelerating Robotics & UAV Innovation with MATLAB & Simulink

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1, an insightful session was conducted by Dr. Richa Singh, Application Engineer at MathWorks, along with Mr. Kapil Koul, Lead ‚Äì Startup Accelerator Program at MathWorks.

The session introduced the cohort to how model-based design can streamline the development of autonomous systems using MATLAB and Simulink‚Äîcovering system-level simulation, motion planning, AI integration, and embedded deployment.

The session also highlighted the MathWorks Startup Accelerator Program, which supports early-stage ventures with tools, mentorship, and resources to move from idea to implementation efficiently.
Riya Singha Singh, Associate ‚Äì Programs & Initiatives at iCreate, coordinated the session as part of the cohort‚Äôs technical learning track, ensuring a valuable knowledge exchange between the innovators and industry experts.

Not every great idea survives the leap from whiteboard to world.
Robotics and hardware startups often falter, not for lack of tech, but because their business models aren't built for the real world.
That‚Äôs where ProtoQuik Launchpad steps in. In just 30 days, founders move from theory to traction‚Äîtesting fast, adapting faster, and building for what actually works.
Because real ventures aren‚Äôt built in pitch decks. They‚Äôre forged in reality with the right mentorship and opportunities.
